text: the greatest meal I cooked in my life
was never in a
restaurant and I'll stand by that 100% I
have a uh I have a lot of great
customers over the years uh that um love
my food and uh this particular customer
has a couple houses around the world and
one time when I was in Japan visiting um
you I was V they were in Tokyo and I
um we went with uh I was going around
seeing a bunch of different sites and I
went to kabashi which is like the
restaurant row Supply row of um Tokyo
it's like 2 miles long it's this crazy
place and there was a store there that
just sold yakatori equipment to make a
Japanese yakatori and she's a little bit
food crazy and um she's like oh I got to
have some charcoal I got to have some
charcoal for all my for my grill in New
York and my Grill in France so she
bought like a couple hundred pounds of
charcoal and like flew it to France and
to New
York uh the following summer I borrowed
their house uh in the south of France
they let me have it for a little bit and
um at the end of it as a thank you I
cook them dinner and they have this
beautiful outdoor grill that looks over
the Mediterranean and they had a bag of
this Japanese charcoal from Tokyo so I
went to Buu suir and bought bunch of
vegetables and some produce and I went
to the market in nice and I bought some
fish and some baby lamb and I cooked
everything all the French ingredients
with the Japanese charcoal on this Grill
and um my uh my som's parents I invited
them over and they brought like homemade
vange and homemade lemon cello and there
were some homemade wine in the mix but
the the combination of like this
Japanese charcoal cooking on the Open
Fire Grill in wood burning oven and the
French ingredients just was amazing and
the setting was amazing and the company
was amazing and those sometimes are the
most amazing food experiences you can
have in your life as opposed to you know
the super
high-end uh kind of
setting J
